text: • If your home of record is Missouri or you had Missouri source income, complete this form only after Form MO-1040, Lines 1 through 23 or Form MO-1040C, Lines 1
label: BODY

text: • If you filed a joint federal return, you must file a combined Missouri return (even if only one of you had Missouri income) and complete each column below. Do not
label: BODY

text: combine Missouri source income for yourself and your spouse.
label: BODY

text: • Military pay of a nonresident stationed in Missouri should not be included in Missouri source income.
label: BODY

text: • If you are a nonresident stationed in Missouri or you moved into Missouri after December 31, 1999 and neither you nor your spouse had Missouri source income, check this
label: BODY

text: and complete Part A and Part B below. You are not required to file a Missouri return. Sign Form MO-NRI on reverse side and send Form MO-NRI along with all Form
label: BODY

text: W-2(s) to: Missouri Department of Revenue, P.O. Box 3900, Jefferson City, MO  65105-3900. Military personnel must enclose a Leave and Earnings Statement.

text: What are the federal line references on the worksheet used for?
label: HH1

text: You must determine what portion of each line on the federal return is Missouri Source Income. The federal line references will help you find the information needed on
label: BODY

text: What is Missouri source income and how do I determine the Missouri source income for myself and my spouse?
label: BODY

text: Missouri source income is the income earned in Missouri. It includes: (1) wages earned in Missouri; (2) income from business, trade profession or occupation carried
label: BODY

text: on in Missouri; (3) income from real or tangible personal property in Missouri; and (4) interest, dividends and pension income received during the time you/your spouse
label: BODY

text: was a Missouri resident. You should use the schedule on page 6 of the Form MO-1040C and on page 4 of the Form MO-1040 to allocate your income between you
label: BODY

text: and your spouse. You should determine what portion of each line on your federal income tax return is Missouri source income for yourself and your spouse and enter
label: BODY

text: on the appropriate line on the worksheet above.
label: BODY

text: If I have only rental property in Missouri, do I have to complete the Form MO-NRI?
label: BODY

text: YES!! The amount of rental income received from a Missouri property is taxable to Missouri, if $600 or more.
label: BODY

text: Should I enclose a copy of my federal return?
label: BODY

text: YES!!  A copy of your federal return is needed to verify information and may prevent a delay in the processing of your Missouri return.
label: BODY

text: If I am in the military, stationed in Missouri, but my home of record is not Missouri and my spouse had Missouri source income, is he/she required to
label: BODY

text: YES!  Both of you need to complete the Form MO-NRI. If you had military income only, your Missouri income percentage would be 0 percent. If your spouse’s
label: BODY

text: total income was Missouri source, 100 percent should be entered as the Missouri income percentage. As a nonresident of Missouri, any income from a Missouri
label: BODY

text: source (excluding military pay) will be taxed by Missouri. The Form MO-NRI should be completed to indicate your and your spouse’s Missouri income percentage.
label: BODY

text: If I have a Missouri domicile and I am stationed outside of Missouri, but my spouse remained in Missouri, do I have to pay Missouri tax on my military
label: BODY

text: YES!  100 percent of your military income and your spouse’s income would be taxable to Missouri.
label: BODY

text: which he/she has any knowledge. As provided in Chapter 143, RSMo, a penalty of up to $500 shall be imposed on any individual who files a frivolous return.
